edu.metrostate.ics372.thatgroup.clinicaltrial.catalog

Interface TrialCatalog

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ClinicalTrialCatalog

    public interface TrialCatalog
    The TrialCatalog interface is used to access the data of a specific trial. You can check for the existence of, create, update, delete, and retrieve data for clinics, patients, and readings.
    Author:
    That Group

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean exists(Clinic clinic)
      Returns true if the specified clinic exists within this catalog; otherwise false is returned.
      boolean exists(Patient patient)
      Returns true if the specified patient exists within this catalog; otherwise false is returned.
      boolean exists(Reading reading)
      Returns true if the specified reading exists within this catalog; otherwise false is returned.
      Clinic get(Clinic clinic)
      If the specified clinic id specifies a valid clinic, then a new Clinic is created and populated with the retrieved data and returned; otherwise null is returned.
      Patient get(Patient patient)
      If the specified patient id specifies a valid patient, then a new Patient is created populated with the retrieved data and returned; otherwise null is returned.
      Reading get(Reading reading)
      If the specified reading id specifies a valid reading, then a new Reading is created and populated with the retrieved data and returned; otherwise null is returned.
      java.util.List<Patient> getActivePatients()
      Returns a List<Patient> of all the patients that are currently active in the active trial.
      java.util.List<Clinic> getClinics()
      Returns a List<Clinic> of all the clinics in the active trial.
      Clinic getDefaultClinic()
      Returns the default clinic for this trial.
      Patient getDefaultPatient()
      Returns the default patient for this trial.
      java.util.List<Patient> getInactivePatients()
      Returns a List<Patient> of all the patients that are currently not active in the active trial.
      java.util.List<Patient> getPatients()
      Returns a List<Patient> of all the patients in the active trial.
      java.util.List<Reading> getReadings()
      Returns a List<Reading> of all the readings in the active trial.
      java.util.List<Reading> getReadings(Clinic clinic)
      Returns a List<Reading> of all the readings in the active trial for the specified clinic.
      java.util.List<Reading> getReadings(Patient patient)
      Returns a List<Reading> of all the readings in the active trial for the specified patient.
      boolean init(Trial trial)
      Initializes the trial catalog and sets the specified trial as the active trial.
      boolean insert(Clinic clinic)
      Inserts the specified clinic into the catalog.
      boolean insert(Patient patient)
      Inserts the specified patient into the catalog.
      boolean insert(Reading reading)
      Inserts the specified reading into the catalog.
      boolean isInit()
      Returns true if the catalog has been initialized; otherwise false is returned.
      boolean remove(Clinic clinic)
      Removes the specified clinic from the catalog.
      boolean remove(Patient patient)
      Removes the specified patient from the catalog.
      boolean remove(Reading patient)
      Removes the specified reading from the catalog.
      boolean update(Clinic clinic)
      Updates the existing clinic record, specified by the clinic id of the specified clinic, with the information contained within the specified clinic.
      boolean update(Patient patient)
      Updates the existing patient record, specified by the patient id of the specified patient, with the information contained within the specified patient.
      boolean update(Reading reading)
      Updates the existing reading record, specified by the reading id of the specified patient, with the information contained within the specified reading.

    • Method Detail

      • init

        boolean init(Trial trial)
      throws TrialCatalogException
        Initializes the trial catalog and sets the specified trial as the active trial. Returns true if the catalog was successfully initialized and is ready to be used; otherwise false is returned.
        Parameters:
        trial - the id of the Trial to be retrieved and activated must be set. If the id field identifies a valid trial, the remaining fields of the specified trial are populated with the retrieved data, the trial becomes the active trial and the method returns true; otherwise false is returned.
        Returns:
        true if the catalog was successfully initialized and is ready to be used; otherwise false is returned.
        Throws:
        TrialCatalogException - indicates that trial is null or that an error occurred during the initialization process.

      • isInit

        boolean isInit()
        Returns true if the catalog has been initialized; otherwise false is returned.
        Returns:
        true if the catalog has been initialized; otherwise false is returned.

      • exists

        boolean exists(Clinic clinic)
        throws TrialCatalogException
        Returns true if the specified clinic exists within this catalog; otherwise false is returned.
        Parameters:
        clinic - the id of the Clinic to be checked must be set. If the id field identifies a valid clinic then the method returns true; otherwise false is returned.
        Returns:
        true if the id field identifies a valid clinic; otherwise false is returned.
        Throws:
        TrialCatalogException - indicates that clinic is null or another type of error occurred.

      • insert

        boolean insert(Clinic clinic)
        throws TrialCatalogException
        Inserts the specified clinic into the catalog. If the specified clinic already exists, a TrialCatalogException will be thrown. Returns true if the specified clinic was inserted in to the catalog; otherwise false is returned.
        Parameters:
        clinic - the Clinic to be insert in to the catalog.
        Returns:
        true if the specified clinic was inserted in to the catalog; otherwise false is returned.
        Throws:
        TrialCatalogException - indicates that clinic is null, the specified clinic id already exists, or another type of error occurred.

      • get

        Clinic get(Clinic clinic)
    throws TrialCatalogException
        If the specified clinic id specifies a valid clinic, then a new Clinic is created and populated with the retrieved data and returned; otherwise null is returned.
        Parameters:
        clinic - the id of the Clinic to be retrieved must be set. If the id field identifies a valid clinic, a new Clinic is created and its fields are populated with the retrieved data and returned; otherwise null is returned.
        Returns:
        the specified clinic; otherwise null.
        Throws:
        TrialCatalogException - indicates that clinic is null or an error was encountered.

      • getDefaultClinic

        Clinic getDefaultClinic()
                 throws TrialCatalogException
        Returns the default clinic for this trial.
        Returns:
        the default clinic for this trial.
        Throws:
        TrialCatalogException - indicates that an error was encountered.

      • update

        boolean update(Clinic clinic)
        throws TrialCatalogException
        Updates the existing clinic record, specified by the clinic id of the specified clinic, with the information contained within the specified clinic. Returns true if the updated information was saved; otherwise false is returned.
        Parameters:
        clinic - the clinic must not be null and the id of the specified clinic must be a valid id for a clinic within this catalog.
        Returns:
        true if the updated information was saved; otherwise false is returned.
        Throws:
        TrialCatalogException - indicates that clinic is null or an error was encountered.

      • remove

        boolean remove(Clinic clinic)
        throws TrialCatalogException
        Removes the specified clinic from the catalog. A clinic can only be removed from the catalog if it does not have any associated readings.
        Parameters:
        clinic - the clinic must not be null and the id of the specified clinic must be a valid id for a clinic within this catalog.
        Returns:
        true if the clinic was removed from the catalog; otherwise false is returned.
        Throws:
        TrialCatalogException - indicates that clinic is null or an error was encountered such as the clinic having associated readings.

      • exists

        boolean exists(Patient patient)
        throws TrialCatalogException
        Returns true if the specified patient exists within this catalog; otherwise false is returned.
        Parameters:
        patient - the id of the Patient to be checked must be set. If the id field identifies a valid patient then the method returns true; otherwise false is returned.
        Returns:
        true if the id field identifies a valid patient; otherwise false is returned.
        Throws:
        TrialCatalogException - indicates that patient is null or another type of error occurred.

      • insert

        boolean insert(Patient patient)
        throws TrialCatalogException
        Inserts the specified patient into the catalog. If the specified patient already exists, a TrialCatalogException will be thrown. Returns true if the specified patient was inserted in to the catalog; otherwise false is returned.
        Parameters:
        patient - the Patient to be insert in to the catalog.
        Returns:
        true if the specified patient was inserted in to the catalog; otherwise false is returned.
        Throws:
        TrialCatalogException - indicates that patient is null, the specified patient id already exists, or another type of error occurred.

      • get

        Patient get(Patient patient)
     throws TrialCatalogException
        If the specified patient id specifies a valid patient, then a new Patient is created populated with the retrieved data and returned; otherwise null is returned.
        Parameters:
        patient - the id of the Patient to be retrieved must be set. If the id field identifies a valid patient, a new Patient is created and its fields are populated with the retrieved data and the method returns a reference to it; otherwise null is returned.
        Returns:
        true if the specified patient was retrieved; otherwise false.
        Throws:
        TrialCatalogException - indicates that patient is null or an error was encountered.

      • getDefaultPatient

        Patient getDefaultPatient()
                   throws TrialCatalogException
        Returns the default patient for this trial.
        Returns:
        the default patient for this trial.
        Throws:
        TrialCatalogException - indicates that an error was encountered.

      • update

        boolean update(Patient patient)
        throws TrialCatalogException
        Updates the existing patient record, specified by the patient id of the specified patient, with the information contained within the specified patient. Returns true if the updated information was saved; otherwise false is returned.
        Parameters:
        patient - the patient must not be null and the id of the specified patient must be a valid id for a patient within this catalog.
        Returns:
        true if the updated information was saved; otherwise false is returned.
        Throws:
        TrialCatalogException - indicates that patient is null or an error was encountered.

      • remove

        boolean remove(Patient patient)
        throws TrialCatalogException
        Removes the specified patient from the catalog. A patient can only be removed from the catalog if it does not have any associated readings.
        Parameters:
        patient - the patient must not be null and the id of the specified patient must be a valid id for a patient within this catalog.
        Returns:
        true if the patient was removed from the catalog; otherwise false is returned.
        Throws:
        TrialCatalogException - indicates that patient is null or an error was encountered such as the patient having associated readings.

      • exists

        boolean exists(Reading reading)
        throws TrialCatalogException
        Returns true if the specified reading exists within this catalog; otherwise false is returned.
        Parameters:
        reading - the id of the Reading to be checked must be set. If the id field identifies a valid reading then the method returns true; otherwise false is returned.
        Returns:
        true if the id field identifies a valid reading; otherwise false is returned.
        Throws:
        TrialCatalogException - indicates that reading is null or another type of error occurred.

      • insert

        boolean insert(Reading reading)
        throws TrialCatalogException
        Inserts the specified reading into the catalog. If the specified reading already exists, a TrialCatalogException will be thrown. Returns true if the specified reading was inserted in to the catalog; otherwise false is returned.
        Parameters:
        reading - the Reading to be insert in to the catalog.
        Returns:
        true if the specified reading was inserted in to the catalog; otherwise false is returned.
        Throws:
        TrialCatalogException - indicates that reading is null, the specified reading id already exists, or another type of error occurred.

      • get

        Reading get(Reading reading)
     throws TrialCatalogException
        If the specified reading id specifies a valid reading, then a new Reading is created and populated with the retrieved data and returned; otherwise null is returned.
        Parameters:
        reading - the id of the Reading to be retrieved must be set. If the id field identifies a valid reading, a new Reading is created and populated with the retrieved data and the method returns a reference to the new reading; otherwise null is returned.
        Returns:
        true if the specified reading was retrieved; otherwise false.
        Throws:
        TrialCatalogException - indicates that reading is null or an error was encountered.

      • update

        boolean update(Reading reading)
        throws TrialCatalogException
        Updates the existing reading record, specified by the reading id of the specified patient, with the information contained within the specified reading. Returns true if the updated information was saved; otherwise false is returned.
        Parameters:
        reading - the reading must not be null and the id of the specified reading must be a valid id for a reading within this catalog.
        Returns:
        true if the updated information was saved; otherwise false is returned.
        Throws:
        TrialCatalogException - indicates that reading is null or an error was encountered.

      • remove

        boolean remove(Reading patient)
        throws TrialCatalogException
        Removes the specified reading from the catalog.
        Parameters:
        reading - the reading must not be null and the id of the specified reading must be a valid id for a reading within this catalog.
        Returns:
        true if the reading was removed from the catalog; otherwise false is returned.
        Throws:
        TrialCatalogException - indicates that reading is null or an error was encountered.

      • getClinics

        java.util.List<Clinic> getClinics()
                           throws TrialCatalogException
        Returns a List<Clinic> of all the clinics in the active trial.
        Returns:
        a List<Clinic> of all the clinics in the active trial.
        Throws:
        TrialCatalogException - indicates there is no active trial or an error was encountered.

      • getPatients

        java.util.List<Patient> getPatients()
                             throws TrialCatalogException
        Returns a List<Patient> of all the patients in the active trial.
        Returns:
        a List<Patient> of all the patients in the active trial.
        Throws:
        TrialCatalogException - indicates there is no active trial or an error was encountered.

      • getActivePatients

        java.util.List<Patient> getActivePatients()
                                   throws TrialCatalogException
        Returns a List<Patient> of all the patients that are currently active in the active trial.
        Returns:
        a List<Patient> of all the patients that are currently active in the active trial.
        Throws:
        TrialCatalogException - indicates there is no active trial or an error was encountered.

      • getInactivePatients

        java.util.List<Patient> getInactivePatients()
                                     throws TrialCatalogException
        Returns a List<Patient> of all the patients that are currently not active in the active trial.
        Returns:
        a List<Patient> of all the patients that are currently not active in the active trial.
        Throws:
        TrialCatalogException - indicates there is no active trial or an error was encountered.

      • getReadings

        java.util.List<Reading> getReadings()
                             throws TrialCatalogException
        Returns a List<Reading> of all the readings in the active trial.
        Returns:
        a List<Reading> of all the readings in the active trial.
        Throws:
        TrialCatalogException - indicates there is no active trial or an error was encountered.

      • getReadings

        java.util.List<Reading> getReadings(Patient patient)
                             throws TrialCatalogException
        Returns a List<Reading> of all the readings in the active trial for the specified patient. The specified patient must contain a valid id and must exist in this catalog.
        Parameters:
        patient - the specified patient to retrieve the readings for. the specified patient cannot be null and must have a valid id.
        Returns:
        a List<Reading> of all the readings in the active trial for the specified patient.
        Throws:
        TrialCatalogException - indicates that patient is null, there is no active trial or an error was encountered.

      • getReadings

        java.util.List<Reading> getReadings(Clinic clinic)
                             throws TrialCatalogException
        Returns a List<Reading> of all the readings in the active trial for the specified clinic. The specified clinic must contain a valid id and must exist in this catalog.
        Parameters:
        clinic - the specified clinic to retrieve the readings for. the specified clinic cannot be null and must have a valid id.
        Returns:
        a List<Reading> of all the readings in the active trial for the specified clinic.
        Throws:
        TrialCatalogException - indicates that clinic is null, there is no active trial or an error was encountered.
